definition: Black Register of Lost Souls, long novel by Peng Yangou 彭養鷗|彭养鸥 about the destructive influence of opium, published in 1897 and 1909
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
black/dark/sinister/secret/shady/illegal/to hide (sth) away/to vilify/(loanword) to hack (computing)
book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership
surname Ji
injustice/grievance/wrong
old variant of 冤[yuan1]
old variant of 魂[hun2]
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
Uncle Tom's Cabin, translated and adapted by Lin Shu 林紓|林纾

Flower in the sea of evil, late Qing novel by Jin Tianhe 金天翮[Jin1 Tian1 he2]
machine-operated stage scenery
Wu Jianren (1867-1910), late Qing dynasty novelist, author of The strange state of the world witnessed over 20 years 二十年目睹之怪現狀|二十年目睹之怪现状
Qing dynasty novel the Western Chamber by Yuan Yuling 袁于令[Yuan2 Yu2 ling4]/same as 西樓夢|西楼梦
Zhang Chunfan (-1935), late Qing novelist, author of The Nine-tailed Turtle 九尾龜|九尾龟
return of the prodigal son
The Gallant Maid, novel by Manchu-born Qing dynasty writer 文康[Wen2 Kang1]
political street theater (loanword from Zhivaya Gazeta, or Living Newspaper, Russian theater form of the 1920s)

Short History of Civilization, late Qing novel by Li Boyuan 李伯元[Li3 Bo2 yuan2] or Li Baojia 李寶嘉|李宝嘉[Li3 Bao3 jia1] describing the turmoil after the 1900 Eight-Nation Alliance 八國聯軍|八国联军[Ba1 guo2 Lian2 jun1]

Mei Lanfang (1894-1961), famous master of Beijing opera, specialist in female roles
